Class UserInterface

java.lang.Object
UserInterface
public class UserInterface
extends java.lang.Object
This a project management program where the user is able to register, store and modify a project.

Version:
%I%,%G%
Author:
Jesse Muka

    • dateComparer

      public static void dateComparer​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list, int userChoice, java.lang.String dateFromProject, java.util.Date currentDate)
      This method compares the current date with a user selected project

      Parameters:
      list - the arraylist which the date element is stored
      userChoice - the selection of the user
      dateFromProject - the deadline date of the project the user selected
      currentDate - the current date

    • appendToFileModification

      public static void appendToFileModification​(java.lang.String fileName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> arrayList, int userSelection)
      This method appends a user selected project that has been modified.

      Parameters:
      fileName - destination file
      arrayList - arraylist from which the project is selected from
      userSelection - selection of the user used to get the project object from arraylist

    • appendToFileRegistration

      public static void appendToFileRegistration​(java.lang.String fileName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> arrayList)
      This method writes a new project that has been registered by the user.
      Parameters:
      fileName - the destination file
      arrayList - the arraylist which the project object is temporarily stored

    • displayProjects

      public static void displayProjects​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> arrayList)
      This method displays the projects that are stored in an arraylist, the method iterates through an arraylist to display the projects to a user
      Parameters:
      arrayList - the arraylist in which the projects are imported from a file and stored

    • stringFormatter

      public static java.lang.String stringFormatter​(java.lang.String projectName, int projectNumber, java.lang.String buildingType, java.lang.String physicalAddressOfProject, int erfNumberForProject, float projectFee, float outstandingBalance, java.lang.String projectDeadline)
      Formats multiple data types into one string element.
      Parameters:
      projectName - the name of the project
      projectNumber - the number specific to a project
      buildingType - the building type
      physicalAddressOfProject - the address of the project
      erfNumberForProject - the erf number of the project
      projectFee - the project fee
      outstandingBalance - the outstanding balance of the project
      projectDeadline - the deadline date of the project
      Returns:
      the newly formatted string is returned
      See Also:
      Project

      Parameters:
      array - the array from which the strings are taken from
      list - the arraylist the elements are added

    • stringSplitterProjectEditor

      public static java.lang.String[] stringSplitterProjectEditor​(java.util.List<java.lang.String> list, java.lang.String[] arrayOfStrings, int userChoice)
      Gets a string object and splits the object at at the delimiter specified as a comma and a space, this is used is the project modification section
      Parameters:
      list - the arraylist whihc the string object is stored
      arrayOfStrings - the array which the string object is split and stored
      userChoice - the selection of the string by the user
      Returns:
      the array of split string objects is returned

      public static void dataImporter​(java.lang.String fileName, java.util.List<java.lang.String> list) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException

      Parameters:
      fileName - the file from which the methods gets data
      list - the arraylist which the data is added
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - if the file is not found, this exception is thrown
